name: Java Logo
body:
Home
====

Logo was originally designed in 1967 Daniel G. Bobrow, Wally Feurzeig, Seymour Papert and Cynthia Solomon.
It is now well know for begging the 'turtle' programming language. The only problem with Logo is that
as it is under the public domain, every version is slightly different, so if you download a version for
mac and then a version for windows, you will get different versions that run differently. We have the solution. Java logo can run on any kind of computer that runs java and with help from @louisdw1, I have created a version of the brilliant logo program.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
